summary: This bill, the Joshua Tree National Park Expansion Act (H.R. 3414), proposes to expand the boundary of Joshua Tree National Park by approximately 20,149 acres, transfer administrative jurisdiction of the added land from the Bureau of Land Management to the National Park Service, and authorize land acquisition within the expanded boundary. It also includes a technical correction and renames the Cottonwood Visitor Center as the Dianne Feinstein Visitor Center.
